newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy DPEF plan to be approved next week -minister.
newsitem.headline: Italy DPEF plan to be approved next week -minister.

text.p: Italian regional affairs minister Franco Bassanini said on Friday that the government's three-year programme of economic targets (DPEF) will "certainly" be approved by a cabinet meeting next week.
Asked by reporters when this would be he replied, "usually cabinet meetings are held on a Friday, barring other engagements of the Prime Minister."
Prime Minister Romano Prodi is provisionally due to be in Paris on Tuesday and the Hague on Wednesday.

The long-awaited document, expected to provide outlines of key welfare reforms as well as targets to form the basis for Italy's convergence plan to join the single European currency, had been expected to go before the cabinet this week. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
